intro: Pediomelum aromaticum var. barnebyi, commonly known as the Barneby's pediomelum, is a rare and lesser-known member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, aromatic leaves that emit a subtle, spicy scent when crushed. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is native to specific regions in the southwestern United States. Its small, yellowish-white flowers are clustered in umbels, a common feature among members of its family. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
